Deficiency Narrative: During the inspection it was observed that multiple serious incident reports were missing information like the nature of the incident, and the names of witnesses, residents, & staff involved.
Correction Narrative: The Document has been corrected by adding word prompts for staff members to better describe the incidents nature, cause, techniques used to deescalate, and the outcome and solutions. Also, an area has been added to include the names of individuals that witnessed the incident. Please see attached document.

Deficiency Narrative: During the inspection it was discovered that the fire inspection certificate was expired.
Correction Narrative: The operation emailed RCCR Inspector Ibrahim Fye a copy of the newly completed fire inspection. See document library.

Deficiency Narrative: A staff member admitted to preparing and administering medication for the evening and following morning for five out of six kids.
Correction Narrative: The staff involved has been discipline and retrained on appropriate medication preparation and administration. The staff member also completed a DFPS Psychotropic Medication training and was taken off the schedule as a disciplinary action.

Deficiency Narrative: One of the four files did not include the copy of child's rights.
Correction Narrative: The child's right document will be obtained and signed during the admission and orientation process. During the biweekly to monthly folder checks the documents presence will be checked by the assistant director and LCCA.

Deficiency Narrative: The staff list provided included names that are no longer employed at the operation.
Correction Narrative: The staff list and background check list will be updated as staff member is hired or no longer present on the work schedule. These lists will be routinely checked by assistant director and LCCA.

Deficiency Narrative:
Both first aid kits did not include a thermometer. 

This standard was corrected by putting working thermometers in the kit.
An urinalysis strip was observed to be expired in August of 2023.   This was corrected during the inspection by discarding it immediately.
Five out of six child medication counts were not accurate due to being predated.
Correction Narrative: During the follow up inspection the medication pill count was accurate and not prepped hours in advance. The medication log was observed to not be filled out in advance.

Deficiency Narrative: Based on the training certificates reviewed it was discovered that some of the staff did not complete required annual trainings within the allowed subsequent 12-month period. These trainings include Psychotropic Medication for Children in Texas Foster Care Training and Preventing and Recognizing Sexual Abuse and Victimization of Youth in Foster Care Training.
Correction Narrative: A training checklist has been created by the administrator containing the trainings required to fulfill minimum standards annually. The training checklist will be placed in each staff members folder by the administrator and a copy in a Master Folder titled Annual Training. The date of each staff members current training will be documented, along with the annual due date. These dates will also be documented and displayed on a Training Calendar in the main business office.  Administrator and Lead Supervisor will be responsible for checking each staff members filed checklist on a monthly basis for staff members who will need to complete their trainings for the current month.  A memo will also be given to staff members who need to complete training for the month at least 2 weeks prior to their due date.

Deficiency Narrative: When reviewing the EBI policy, it stated that a personal restraint may not exceed one hour.
Correction Narrative: An email was received from the operation's administrator that included a response to the citation which stated that each staff was counseled with and informed of the correct maximum time for a resident to be in a restraint and signed a document indicating they are aware of the change. The EBI policy was corrected to state " The maximum length of time for a personal restraint for child of any age is 30 minutes".

Deficiency Narrative: A child in care sustained an injury that required treatment by a medical professional and the operation failed to report the incident to statewide intake.
Correction Narrative: An email was received from administrator Demeteria Tezeno stating it will be the responsibility of Demeteria Tezeno to report all serious medical care administered to residence to licensing with in 24 hours.

Deficiency Narrative: A bottle of what appears to be laundry detergent or fabric softener and an aerosol can of disinfectant/air freshener was observed to be in a resident's bedroom and accessible to all children in care.
Correction Narrative: A bottle of what appears to be laundry detergent or fabric softener and an aerosol can of disinfectant/air freshener was observed to be in a resident's bedroom and accessible to all children in care.

Deficiency Narrative: The operation's staff did not follow their written policies and procedures regarding hazardous chemicals use and storage when two cleaning/laundry products were observed to be unsecured and easily accessible to children in care.
Correction Narrative: The operation's staff did not follow their written policies and procedures regarding hazardous chemicals use and storage when two cleaning/laundry products were observed to be unsecured and easily accessible to children in care.

Deficiency Narrative: All posted evacuation diagrams were modified and included a designated place written however did not match with the area distinctly marked with a star in the emergency evacuation diagram. The diagrams are inconsistent and inaccurate.
Correction Narrative: All posted evacuation diagrams were modified and are in compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: Licensing was not notified of children's unauthorized absence until nearly 12hours after the children left the operation without permission.
Correction Narrative: This task of reporting or making notifications is no longer staff's responsibility, it will be Administrative staff's responsibility.

Deficiency Narrative: Three out of three youth interviewed stated a caregiver makes smart alleck statements toward them.
Correction Narrative: Children interviewed reported that staff do not use sarcastic, rude humor or say anything innapropriate or hurtful towards children in care.

Deficiency Narrative: All posted evacuation diagrams should have a designated place written or outlined in the emergency evacuation diagram.
An electrical outlet cover was observed in the boys house in the bedroom to the right to be missing on an outlet actively being used by children in care to charge electronics.
Correction Narrative: An electrical outlet cover was observed, and the building was in good repair.

Deficiency Narrative: 3 of 3 child discharge files were observed without documentation confirming when the children were informed of thier discharge or tranfer.
4 of 4 bathrooms accessible to children were observed without soap near the handwashing sink. 1 of 4 bathrooms accessible to children were observed without toliet paper.
All posted evacuation diagrams were observed and a supervisor confirmed that there was no idenified for sheltering inside.
On June 21 in the girls house in the refrigerator there was a gallon of milk was observed with an expiration date of May 18.
All nutrients menus were observed without food substitutions documented on the menus.
Correction Narrative: All nutrients menus were observed with food substitutions documented on the menus.

Deficiency Narrative: 2 of 7 children's file reviewed were observed without a signed copy of child's rights.
2 of 2 binders containing medication records were observed on a desk in the common areas.
Correction Narrative: The records were observed to be stored and kept confidential in a locked office.

Deficiency Narrative: 2 serious incident reports were observed with inaccurate dates of birth of children in care.
Correction Narrative: The documentation was corrected.

Deficiency Narrative: A child didn't return home from school at the regularly scheduled time which is approximately 3:46-4:00pm. The unauthorized absence was not reported until 1:41am the following morning.
Correction Narrative: This task of reporting or making notifications is no longer staff's responsibility, it will be Administrative staff's responsibility.

Deficiency Narrative: The operation failed to submit quarterly EBI data for the 4th quarter on time.
Correction Narrative: EBI data was submitted. An email with written corrections was received sating: L'Amor Village Residential Treatment Facility will have this deficiency corrected for the next quarters. To remain in compliance the due dates for each Quarterly EBI have been documented on a calendar, an alarm has been set on the main computer, and the DFPS Provider Portal will be monitored daily for needed information.

Deficiency Narrative: Report was not able to be given at time of inspection.
Correction Narrative: The Unauthorized Absence Evaluation documentation was received. No concerns were found.

Deficiency Narrative: On 12/5/22 a child received medical treatment at Brazos Urgent Care. This situation was not reported to the hotline as required.
Correction Narrative: The operation reported the incident today to the hotline in order to come into compliance. The operation also acknowledged in an email that they will report any future incidents that meet the requirements of standard 748.303(a)(2)(A).

Deficiency Narrative: It was noted that Ms. Sweed's EBI training expired on 05/12/22.
Correction Narrative: An email of the certificate of completion for EBI was received for the staff member. No concerns were found.

Deficiency Narrative: 5 children admitted that a staff member uses vulgar language in front of them.
Correction Narrative:
5 children admitted that a staff member uses vulgar language in front of them. 

3 children were interviewed today, and there were no concerns with the interviews.

Deficiency Narrative: It was found during the course of the investigation that staff got into a verbal altercation with a child in care's visitor. In addition, it was also found that a staff sometimes yell.
Correction Narrative:
Staff members involved in the verbal altercation with the resident's mother attended a training lead by Case Manager Patrick Oliphant, LMSW. Staff members had to explain how they must be responsible in all situations to ensure and maintain that each child's rights are fulfilled. Topics of Training: Behavior Management Techniques, Styles of Communication, De-Escalation Techniques, and Revisiting Child's Rights. 

Signatures of employee attendance were provided. No concerns were found.

Deficiency Narrative: The operation did not have an annual summary log readily available for review.
Correction Narrative:
The operation submitted the following correction: L'Amor Village RTC has added an Unauthorized Absence Log Form to Unauthorized Absence binder that was present the day of the investigation. 
The operation provided the cumulative log with all information of their unauthorized absences for the year.

Deficiency Narrative: Two residents interviewed stated a staff member curses at them. One staff member interviewed stated it has been reported to her that a staff member curses at the residents.
Correction Narrative: During the inspection I spoke with several children in care and there were no additional complaints of staff using profanity towards them. On 01/26 Mary Reece, the administrator sent an email stating that the girl's staff members would be taking several trainings biannually to assist with sensitivity towards children in care.

Deficiency Narrative: Two children in care expressed that a staff grabbed a child in care around the neck and threw him onto the couch to stop them from potentially fighting.
Correction Narrative: Two children in care expressed that a staff grabbed a child in care around the neck and threw him onto the couch to stop them from potentially fighting.

Deficiency Narrative: Direct Care Staff most recent Trauma Informed Care Training was last taken on 10/19/20.
Correction Narrative: Direct Care Staff completed the Trauma Informed Care on 10/25/21.

Deficiency Narrative: A child received two doses of medication that was not prescribed to them.
Correction Narrative:
Written correction was received by Admin on 10/7/21. This error was due to a staff member allowing a child to rush up to the medication desk and grab medications from the medication box without their permission. 
As of 9/28/21, 15 minutes prior to medications being administered at the medication desk, ALL residents will be instructed to return to their bedrooms to wait for further instructions from the staff. All activities are to be stopped until all medications have been administered. Each resident will be called to the medication desk one at a time.

Deficiency Narrative: It was found that the organizational chart was not updated and was missing names of persons under positions listed.
Correction Narrative: An updated organizational chart was sent with the correct information.

Deficiency Narrative: It was found that the inspection was expired.The new inspection conducted 11/11/20 at the facility did not pass .
Correction Narrative: Fire inspection occurred on 1/14/21.

Deficiency Narrative: The service plan review did not have pertinent information regarding supervision of the child, or progress regarding supervision of the child, in the supervision section.
Correction Narrative: The facility sent over a corrective action plan that states that staff will continue to monitor all residents for safety and attainment of therapeutic goals.Our cas manager Mr.Oliphant will continue to update the progress section of the supervision plan according to the resident behaciors as they may or may not change according to the report.All direct care staff involved or who are on duty will write an incident report regarding youth behaviors both positive and negative. The facility also send in an corrected copy of the residents supervision service plan.

Deficiency Narrative: The service plan provided did not have supervision pertinent information regarding the supervision of the child in the supervision section.
Correction Narrative: The facility sent a corrective action plan that states administrative staff met with the Case Manager Mr.Patrick Oliphant and provided both coaching and feedback regarding the information documented in the service plans. Mr Oliphant will document specific triggers and directives for the staff to watch out for when a resident becomes deregulated. Staff will be informed through the service plan of appropriate supervision techniques to be utilized a the time the residents behaviors become out of instructional control. The facility also sent in a corrected copy of the residents supervision plan ,
